text:
what's the difference between
```on:
  push:
    tags:```
and
```on:
  release:```
?  what we should use to trigger compilation of documentation when TagBot does a new release?

_Edit_: nevermind, the problem was probably the missing SSH key in TagBot.  but still a bit confusing they have both releases and tags :weary:

elements.text: ?  what we should use to trigger compilation of documentation when TagBot does a new release?
: nevermind, the problem was probably the missing SSH key in TagBot.  but still a bit confusing they have both releases and tags

text:
> but still a bit confusing they have both releases and tags
They're different things. Tags are a git thing, releases are a GitHub thing.

elements.text: but still a bit confusing they have both releases and tags
They're different things. Tags are a git thing, releases are a GitHub thing.

text: Releases are attached to tags but can contain things like release assets etc

elements.text: Releases are attached to tags but can contain things like release assets etc

text: So you may want to trigger on `tag` to build a release

elements.text: So you may want to trigger on

text: I would suggest tags as well, since a release implies a tag, but not vice versa. And you may want to use just tags when pushing pseudo-releases (`+doc1` type stuff) to fix documentation builds at some point.

elements.text: I would suggest tags as well, since a release implies a tag, but not vice versa. And you may want to use just tags when pushing pseudo-releases (
type stuff) to fix documentation builds at some point.

text: Actually, it might even be that Documenter will not properly work if run on a `release` event, since `deploydocs` wants it to be a tag I think
